title: Numbers Chapter 18 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Numbers chapter 18 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Numbers Chapter 18 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Numbers Chapter 18.

questions.question: Who did the LORD say shall bear the iniquity of the sanctuary according to Numbers 18:1?
questions.correctAnswer: Aaron and his sons
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:1 specifically states that Aaron and his sons shall bear the iniquity of the sanctuary.

questions.question: According to Numbers 18:2, which tribe was to be joined with Aaron to minister?
questions.correctAnswer: Levi
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:2 instructs Aaron to bring his brethren of the tribe of Levi to minister with him.

questions.question: What were the Levites forbidden to come near according to Numbers 18:3?
options: Vessels of the sanctuary and the altar
questions.correctAnswer: Vessels of the sanctuary and the altar
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:3 forbids the Levites from coming near the vessels of the sanctuary and the altar to avoid death.

questions.question: What was given to Aaron and his sons as their charge according to Numbers 18:8?
options: The heave offerings of all the hallowed things
questions.correctAnswer: The heave offerings of all the hallowed things
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:8 says the LORD gave Aaron the charge of the heave offerings of all the hallowed things of Israel.

questions.question: Where were Aaron and his sons to eat the most holy things as stated in Numbers 18:10?
questions.correctAnswer: In the most holy place
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:10 specifies that Aaron and his sons should eat the most holy things in the most holy place.

questions.question: According to Numbers 18:15, what must Aaron surely redeem?
questions.correctAnswer: The firstborn of man
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:15 instructs that the firstborn of man must be surely redeemed by Aaron.

questions.question: What amount is specified for redeeming those from a month old in Numbers 18:16?
questions.correctAnswer: Five shekels
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:16 states the redemption price for those from a month old is five shekels according to the sanctuary shekel.

questions.question: What is the inheritance of Aaron according to Numbers 18:20?
options: A city in the Promised Land
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD Himself
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:20 declares that Aaron shall have no inheritance in the land; the LORD is his inheritance.

questions.question: To whom did the LORD give all the tenth in Israel for an inheritance according to Numbers 18:21?
questions.correctAnswer: The children of Levi
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:21 states that the LORD gave all the tenth in Israel to the children of Levi as their inheritance.

questions.question: According to Numbers 18:23, what shall the Levites bear as part of their service?
questions.correctAnswer: Their iniquity
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:23 says the Levites shall bear their own iniquity as part of their service at the tabernacle.

questions.question: What portion of the tithe must the Levites offer as a heave offering to the LORD according to Numbers 18:26?
questions.correctAnswer: A tenth part
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:26 instructs the Levites to offer a tenth part of the tithes they receive as a heave offering to the LORD.

questions.question: True or False: Numbers 18:7 states that the priest's office was given as a service of gift and that strangers coming near shall be put to death.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:7 clearly says the priest's office is a service of gift and that strangers who come near shall be put to death.

questions.question: True or False: According to Numbers 18:22, the children of Israel are forbidden to come near the tabernacle of the congregation to avoid sin and death.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:22 states the children of Israel must not come near the tabernacle or they will bear sin and die.

questions.question: True or False: Numbers 18:12 says that the best of the oil, wine, and wheat offered to the LORD belong to Aaron.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:12 assigns all the best of the oil, wine, and wheat offered unto the LORD to Aaron.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Numbers 18:28: 'Thus ye also shall offer an heave offering unto the LORD of all your tithes, which ye receive of the children of Israel; and ye shall give thereof the LORD'S heave offering to ________.'
questions.correctAnswer: Aaron the priest
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:28 instructs that the heave offering from the tithes must be given to Aaron the priest.

medium.title: Numbers Chapter 18 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Numbers Chapter 18 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with integrity in their work. Based on Numbers 18, what biblical principle about service and responsibility would you share?
options: Those who serve must bear their iniquity and keep their charge faithfully.
Only the priests are responsible for the sanctuary's care.
Service in the church is optional and without consequences.
Everyone in Israel should minister directly in the tabernacle.
questions.correctAnswer: Those who serve must bear their iniquity and keep their charge faithfully.
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:1-4 emphasize that Aaron, his sons, and the Levites must bear the iniquity and keep the charge of the sanctuary and tabernacle, teaching us faithfulness and responsibility in service.

questions.question: How does Numbers 18 teach us about humility and contentment in relation to inheritance?
options: God is Aaron's inheritance, not land or possessions.
Aaron and his sons should demand a large land inheritance.
The Levites have no portion in the land and are to feel deprived.
Inheritance is only about material wealth.
questions.correctAnswer: God is Aaron's inheritance, not land or possessions.
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:20 teaches that Aaron shall have no inheritance in the land because God Himself is his portion, encouraging humility and contentment in trusting God rather than earthly possessions.

questions.question: A believer asks how to understand generosity and stewardship from Numbers 18 in their giving. What biblical truth would you share?
options: Tithes and offerings are given to support God's servants and must be given faithfully.
Giving is optional and not linked to service in the church.
Only priests receive offerings; Levites do not.
God does not require specific portions from the people.
questions.correctAnswer: Tithes and offerings are given to support God's servants and must be given faithfully.
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:21-24 explain God gave the Levites all the tithes in Israel for their service, teaching stewardship and generosity in supporting those who serve God.

questions.question: What does Numbers 18 teach about the importance of obedience and avoiding sin in service to God?
options: Those who serve must avoid approaching sacred things improperly to avoid death.
Anyone can handle the sanctuary vessels without consequence.
Sin has no effect on those serving in the tabernacle.
Disobedience in service is tolerated by God.
questions.correctAnswer: Those who serve must avoid approaching sacred things improperly to avoid death.
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:3,7,22 warn that unauthorized approach to the sanctuary or altar leads to death, showing God's demand for obedience and holiness in service.

questions.question: How does Numbers 18 encourage believers to trust God's provision in their daily lives?
options: God provides the best of the offerings, firstfruits, and heave offerings as a gift to the priests and Levites.
God expects people to provide everything for themselves without relying on Him.
Provision is only for the wealthy and not for those serving God.
God's provision is random and unreliable.
questions.correctAnswer: God provides the best of the offerings, firstfruits, and heave offerings as a gift to the priests and Levites.
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:9-13 show God giving the best of offerings and firstfruits to Aaron and his sons, teaching reliance on God's provision and generosity.

questions.question: According to Numbers 18, what biblical principle about forgiveness and reconciliation can be applied to family and church life?
options: The priesthood and Levites carry responsibility for sanctifying the community, bearing iniquity to prevent wrath upon Israel.
Family disputes should always lead to exclusion from the church.
Each person is solely responsible for their own sin without intercession.
Forgiveness is not necessary in spiritual service.
questions.correctAnswer: The priesthood and Levites carry responsibility for sanctifying the community, bearing iniquity to prevent wrath upon Israel.
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:1,5,23 show priests and Levites bear iniquity of sanctuary and service to keep God's wrath from Israel, illustrating intercession and reconciliation roles.

questions.question: How does Numbers 18 teach about faithfulness and integrity in handling church resources?
options: Levites must offer a tenth of their tithes as a heave offering to God and give the best to the priests.
Levites can keep all their tithes without giving any to God or priests.
Church resources can be used freely without accountability.
Tithes are only symbolic and not to be treated seriously.
questions.correctAnswer: Levites must offer a tenth of their tithes as a heave offering to God and give the best to the priests.
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:26-29 commands Levites to give a tenth of the tithes as an offering to the LORD, showing faithfulness and integrity in stewardship.

questions.question: True or False: Numbers 18 teaches that the Levites have a permanent inheritance in the land of Israel.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:20,23,24 clearly state that the Levites have no inheritance among the children of Israel except the tithes given them for their service.

questions.question: True or False: The firstborn of unclean animals must be redeemed according to Numbers 18.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:15-16 instruct that the firstborn of unclean beasts are to be redeemed with money, showing God's law of redemption and sanctity.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to Numbers 18, the Levites shall have no _______ among the children of Israel, but they shall inherit the tithes as their _______.
questions.correctAnswer: inheritance, inheritance
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:20-21 states the Levites shall have no inheritance in the land but are given the tithes as their inheritance for service.

questions.question: A believer is discouraged about their role in church service. What encouragement from Numbers 18 about serving God could you share?
options: Serving God is a holy gift and responsibility given by God to His chosen servants.
Service is only for those who seek honor and recognition.
Only priests are important in service; others are irrelevant.
Serving God has no spiritual significance.
questions.correctAnswer: Serving God is a holy gift and responsibility given by God to His chosen servants.
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:7 affirms that the priest's office is a service of gift from God, encouraging faithful and humble service.

questions.question: Based on Numbers 18, how does God demonstrate the principle of generosity to His people?
options: God gives the best firstfruits, offerings, and dedicated gifts to the priests and Levites for their service.
God only blesses those who serve in silence without receiving anything.
Generosity is not emphasized in the offering system.
God expects people to give but does not provide for them.
questions.correctAnswer: God gives the best firstfruits, offerings, and dedicated gifts to the priests and Levites for their service.
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:12-13 shows God gives the best of oil, wine, wheat, and first ripe fruits to the priests, illustrating divine generosity.

questions.question: What guidance about spiritual discipline and reverence does Numbers 18 provide about approaching holy things?
options: Only the priests and Levites may minister before the tabernacle and keep its charge, avoiding unauthorized approach.
Anyone can enter the sanctuary at any time without restriction.
Reverence is optional in serving God.
The holy objects have no special restrictions.
questions.correctAnswer: Only the priests and Levites may minister before the tabernacle and keep its charge, avoiding unauthorized approach.
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:2-4,22 instruct that only Aaron, his sons, and Levites may minister and keep the tabernacle charge, forbidding strangers to approach.

questions.question: How does Numbers 18 teach about the role of family in spiritual responsibility and service?
options: Aaron and his sons share priestly duties and bear the iniquity of the sanctuary together.
Only Aaron serves; his family is excluded.
Family members have no role in spiritual service.
Spiritual service is individual and unrelated to family.
questions.correctAnswer: Aaron and his sons share priestly duties and bear the iniquity of the sanctuary together.
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:1,7,8 show that Aaron and his sons together bear the iniquity and serve in the priesthood, highlighting family responsibility in spiritual service.

questions.question: According to Numbers 18, what is the significance of giving the best of tithes and offerings in service to God?
options: Giving the best honors God and is counted as increased blessing and reward for service.
Giving less than the best is acceptable and equally honored.
Tithes and offerings have no spiritual importance.
Giving is only about fulfilling a duty without heart involvement.
questions.correctAnswer: Giving the best honors God and is counted as increased blessing and reward for service.
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:29-31 teaches that offering the best of the gifts is recognized by God as increased blessing and is a reward for faithful service.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to neglect prayer and devotion. What principle from Numbers 18 about spiritual discipline and reverence can encourage them?
options: The careful service and attention to holy duties in Numbers 18 show the importance of reverence and disciplined devotion to God.
Devotion is unnecessary as long as one is honest in daily work.
Spiritual discipline is only for priests, not for all believers.
God does not require reverence in daily life.
questions.correctAnswer: The careful service and attention to holy duties in Numbers 18 show the importance of reverence and disciplined devotion to God.
questions.explanation: Numbers 18 outlines strict responsibilities and reverence in service, teaching believers to maintain spiritual discipline and respect for God's holiness.

hard.title: Numbers Chapter 18 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Numbers Chapter 18.

questions.question: According to Numbers 18:1, who bears the iniquity of the sanctuary and the priesthood?
questions.correctAnswer: Aaron and his sons
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:1 explicitly states that the LORD said unto Aaron, his sons, and his father's house shall bear the iniquity of the sanctuary and the priesthood.

questions.question: In Numbers 18:2, which tribe is called to minister alongside Aaron and his sons but not to come near the altar or sanctuary vessels?
questions.correctAnswer: Levi
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:2 commands Aaron to bring his brethren of the tribe of Levi to minister with him, but they must not come near the sanctuary vessels or altar.

questions.question: What is the consequence mentioned in Numbers 18:3 for anyone who comes near the vessels of the sanctuary unlawfully?
questions.correctAnswer: They shall die
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:3 warns that neither the Levites nor the priests shall come near the vessels of the sanctuary and altar, lest they die.

questions.question: What is the significance of the Levites being given to Aaron as a gift, according to Numbers 18:6?
options: To perform the service of the tabernacle
To lead the children of Israel
To offer sacrifices outside the tabernacle
questions.correctAnswer: To perform the service of the tabernacle
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:6 states the Levites were taken from among Israel and given to Aaron as a gift for the LORD, to do the service of the tabernacle of the congregation.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to Numbers 18:8, Aaron has been given the charge of the ______ offerings of all the hallowed things of the children of Israel.
questions.correctAnswer: heave
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:8 specifies that the LORD has given Aaron the charge of the heave offerings of all the hallowed things of Israel due to his anointing.

questions.question: According to Numbers 18:9-10, where shall Aaron and his sons eat the most holy things, such as sin offerings and trespass offerings?
questions.correctAnswer: In the most holy place
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:9-10 states that the most holy offerings reserved from the fire shall be eaten by Aaron and his sons in the most holy place and shall be holy unto them.

questions.question: What does Numbers 18:15 instruct regarding the firstborn of man and unclean beasts?
options: They must be left outside the camp
They must be given to the Levites
questions.correctAnswer: They must be redeemed
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:15 commands that the firstborn of man and the firstling of unclean beasts must be redeemed, contrasting with other offerings that are devoted to the LORD.

questions.question: True or False: According to Numbers 18:20, Aaron and his descendants will have an inheritance among the land of Israel.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:20 clearly states that Aaron shall have no inheritance in their land nor part among them; the LORD Himself is his inheritance.

questions.question: What is given to the Levites as an inheritance in Numbers 18:21?
questions.correctAnswer: All the tithes of Israel
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:21 declares that the children of Levi are given all the tenth (tithes) in Israel as their inheritance for their service in the tabernacle.

questions.question: According to Numbers 18:22, why must the children of Israel not come near the tabernacle of the congregation?
options: Lest they bear sin and die
Because it is only for the king
questions.correctAnswer: Lest they bear sin and die
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:22 warns that if the children of Israel approach the tabernacle, they will bear sin and die, emphasizing holiness and separation.

questions.question: What is the statute forever regarding the Levites’ inheritance as stated in Numbers 18:23?
options: They shall have no inheritance among Israel
They shall inherit cities and lands
They shall marry within their tribe
questions.correctAnswer: They shall have no inheritance among Israel
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:23 establishes a lasting statute that Levites have no inheritance in the land of Israel because their inheritance is the tithes given to them.

questions.question: In Numbers 18:26, what portion of the tithe must the Levites offer as a heave offering unto the LORD?
options: A tenth part of the tithe
questions.correctAnswer: A tenth part of the tithe
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:26 commands the Levites to offer a heave offering to the LORD equal to a tenth part of the tithe they receive from Israel.

questions.question: What metaphor is used in Numbers 18:27 to describe the heave offering of the tithe offered by the Levites?
options: Corn of the threshingfloor and fullness of the winepress
The morning dew and evening rain
The fire on the altar and the smoke of incense
questions.correctAnswer: Corn of the threshingfloor and fullness of the winepress
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:27 compares the heave offering of the tithe to the corn of the threshingfloor and the fullness of the winepress, symbolizing abundance.

questions.question: According to Numbers 18:31, where are the Levites and their households permitted to eat the heave offerings they receive?
questions.correctAnswer: In every place
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:31 states that the Levites and their households may eat the heave offerings in every place as their reward for service in the tabernacle.

questions.question: How does Numbers 18:19 describe the covenant given to Aaron and his descendants concerning the heave offerings?
options: A covenant of blood for a limited time
A covenant of land and kingship
A covenant of silence and secrecy
questions.correctAnswer: A covenant of salt forever
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:19 calls the covenant concerning the heave offerings a 'covenant of salt forever' before the LORD, signifying permanence and reliability.

theological.title: Numbers Chapter 18 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Numbers Chapter 18 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Numbers 18, who is responsible for bearing the iniquity of the sanctuary and the priesthood?
questions.correctAnswer: Aaron and his sons
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:1 states that Aaron, his sons, and his father's house shall bear the iniquity of the sanctuary and priesthood. This responsibility is unique to the priestly family, consistent with Hebrews 7:23-28 where Christ as the eternal priest bears our sins.

questions.question: What role do the Levites have in relation to Aaron and the sanctuary service as described in Numbers 18?
options: They minister to Aaron and assist in the tabernacle service
They serve as kings over Israel
They lead the worship in the temple
They are responsible for guarding the city gates
questions.correctAnswer: They minister to Aaron and assist in the tabernacle service
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:2-4 explains that the Levites are to be joined with Aaron to minister before the tabernacle, keeping the charge of the tabernacle and assisting in its service. This typifies the cooperation in worship roles, as seen in 1 Chronicles 23:28-32 and the New Testament priesthood of believers (1 Peter 2:9).

questions.question: What is forbidden to the Levites and priests regarding the sanctuary vessels and altar, and what is the consequence if violated?
options: They must not approach them or they will die
They must only approach on holy days
They must cleanse them before use
questions.correctAnswer: They must not approach them or they will die
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:3 and 18:7 warn that neither Levites nor priests shall come near the vessels of the sanctuary and altar lest they die. This reflects God's holiness and judgment on impurity (Leviticus 10:1-3; Hebrews 12:29).

questions.question: What does God declare as Aaron and his sons' portion or inheritance among the children of Israel?
questions.correctAnswer: God Himself is their inheritance
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:20 states that Aaron shall have no inheritance in the land nor part among the people because God is his portion and inheritance. This echoes Psalm 16:5 and the New Testament's focus on spiritual inheritance (Ephesians 1:11).

questions.question: What are the 'heave offerings' and who is given charge over them according to Numbers 18?
questions.correctAnswer: Aaron and his sons
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:8-11 explains that the heave offerings, which are the holy things from the children of Israel, are given to Aaron and his sons by reason of the anointing. This signifies the priestly stewardship over holy gifts, paralleling Christ's priestly ministry over sacred things (Hebrews 5:1-6).

questions.question: According to Numbers 18, what must be done with the firstborn of unclean beasts and how does this differ from the firstlings of clean animals?
options: Firstborn unclean beasts must be redeemed, clean firstlings are holy and not redeemed
questions.correctAnswer: Firstborn unclean beasts must be redeemed, clean firstlings are holy and not redeemed
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:15-17 teaches that the firstborn of unclean beasts must be redeemed with money, but the firstlings of clean animals are holy and not redeemed; their blood and fat are offered on the altar. This distinction highlights holiness and substitutionary atonement, themes echoed in Leviticus 27:26-27 and Hebrews 9:12-14.

questions.question: What is the significance of the tithe given to the Levites according to Numbers 18?
options: It is their inheritance and sustenance for their service
It is to be given to the king
It is to be burned as a sacrifice
It is stored for the poor only
questions.correctAnswer: It is their inheritance and sustenance for their service
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:21 and 24 declare that the Levites receive all the tithe in Israel as their inheritance for their service in the tabernacle, since they have no land inheritance. This reflects God's provision for His servants, similar to Deuteronomy 14:27 and Malachi 3:10.

questions.question: What is the required offering that Levites must give from their received tithes, as instructed in Numbers 18?
options: A tenth of the tithe as a heave offering to the LORD
All their tithes to the king
Half of the tithes to the poor
questions.correctAnswer: A tenth of the tithe as a heave offering to the LORD
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:26-28 commands the Levites to offer a heave offering of one tenth of the tithes they receive from Israel to the LORD, given to Aaron the priest. This secondary tithe reflects the principle of sacred giving, paralleling Malachi 3:8-10 and Luke 18:12.

questions.question: What is the penalty for a stranger who approaches the priest's office or the sanctuary in Numbers 18?
options: The stranger shall be put to death
questions.correctAnswer: The stranger shall be put to death
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:7 clearly states that a stranger who comes near the priest’s office shall be put to death, emphasizing the holiness and sanctity required for those serving in God's presence, consistent with Leviticus 10:1-2 and Ezekiel 44:9.

questions.question: What is the intended purpose of guarding the sanctuary and altar according to Numbers 18?
options: To prevent wrath upon the children of Israel
To separate the Levites from others
questions.correctAnswer: To prevent wrath upon the children of Israel
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:5 indicates that keeping the charge of the sanctuary and altar is to prevent wrath from falling on Israel. This underscores God's holiness and just judgment, a principle also seen in Exodus 32:35 and Hebrews 10:26-31.

questions.question: What are the Levites permitted to do with the heave offerings and other holy gifts they receive?
options: They may eat them in every place as a reward for their service
They must give them to the poor only
They must store them in the tabernacle
questions.correctAnswer: They may eat them in every place as a reward for their service
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:31 states that the Levites and their households may eat the heave offerings in every place as their reward for service. This reflects God's provision and blessing for those who minister to Him, paralleling Deuteronomy 18:1-5 and 1 Corinthians 9:13-14.

questions.question: What does Numbers 18 teach about inheritance for the children of Levi compared to other tribes?
options: They have no land inheritance, but God and the tithe are their inheritance
They receive the largest land inheritance
They have equal land inheritance to other tribes
questions.correctAnswer: They have no land inheritance, but God and the tithe are their inheritance
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:20-24 clarifies that the Levites have no portion of land among Israel, but God Himself and the tithes are their inheritance. This is consistent with Deuteronomy 10:9 and Hebrews 7:8, emphasizing spiritual inheritance over earthly.

questions.question: What is the significance of the covenant of salt mentioned in Numbers 18:19?
options: A covenant of permanence and preservation before the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: A covenant of permanence and preservation before the LORD
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:19 describes the covenant of salt as an everlasting covenant before the LORD to Aaron and his seed. Salt symbolizes permanence and preservation, as also seen in Leviticus 2:13 and Mark 9:50, signifying God’s enduring promises.

questions.question: According to Numbers 18, what must happen to the blood and fat of the firstlings of cows, sheep, and goats?
options: Blood must be sprinkled on the altar and fat burned as a pleasing aroma to the LORD
They must be eaten by the priests
They should be discarded outside the camp
They must be given to the poor
questions.correctAnswer: Blood must be sprinkled on the altar and fat burned as a pleasing aroma to the LORD
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:17 instructs that the blood of the firstlings must be sprinkled on the altar and their fat burned as an offering by fire for a sweet savour to the LORD. This sacrificial act echoes Leviticus 3:16 and symbolizes atonement (Hebrews 9:14).

questions.question: What does Numbers 18:22 warn the children of Israel against regarding the tabernacle?
options: They must not come near the tabernacle or they will bear sin and die
They must clean the tabernacle regularly
questions.correctAnswer: They must not come near the tabernacle or they will bear sin and die
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:22 warns that the children of Israel must not approach the tabernacle of the congregation to avoid bearing sin and dying, emphasizing God's holiness and separation (Exodus 19:12-13; Hebrews 12:28-29).

questions.question: How does Numbers 18 describe the valuation for redeeming a person from a month old?
options: Five shekels according to the sanctuary shekel
Ten shekels according to the king’s valuation
One shekel according to Israel’s standard
questions.correctAnswer: Five shekels according to the sanctuary shekel
questions.explanation: Numbers 18:16 prescribes that those to be redeemed from one month old must be redeemed at five shekels according to the sanctuary shekel of twenty gerahs. This reflects a divinely ordained valuation system, comparable to Exodus 30:13 and Leviticus 27:6.
